meanings.definition: Reintegrative: serving to reintegrate or restore to a unified whole
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a reintegrative approach to help the students work together as a team.
meanings.sent2: The community center offers reintegrative programs to bring people together.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were being reintegrative, trying to fit back into their original places.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence had a reintegrative effect on the group, bringing them closer.
meanings.sent5: The music had a reintegrative quality, blending different sounds into a harmonious melody.

meanings.definition: Reintegrative: relating to the process of reintegrating individuals into society
meanings.sent1: The social worker provided reintegrative support to help the individual adjust to society.
meanings.sent2: The program focuses on reintegrative efforts for ex-convicts to successfully rejoin society.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy's reintegrative journey back to its owner was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a reintegrative power, making strangers feel welcome in the group.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a reintegrative scene of people coming together in a bustling city.

meanings.definition: Reintegrative: promoting the restoration of unity or harmony
meanings.sent1: The family therapy sessions were reintegrative, aiming to mend relationships.
meanings.sent2: The speech emphasized the importance of reintegrative efforts to maintain peace.
meanings.sent3: The garden's reintegrative design brought together various plants in a beautiful arrangement.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a reintegrative effect, soothing tensions and bringing people closer.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted a reintegrative sky, blending colors seamlessly into a peaceful evening.
